newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Fuel Oil - Supported but talk is thin.
newsitem.headline: Asia Fuel Oil - Supported but talk is thin.

text.p: The Singapore high sulphur fuel oil market was quiet on Friday with little trading interest ahead of the weekend, traders said.
The 180-cst grade was heard offered at $104.50 per tonne but there was no buyer.
The 180-cst grade has been capped at $103.50 per tonne this week, with a recent buyer unwilling to bid up prices.
The local buyer has bought at least five cargoes since last week but traders said his buying was so far routine and did not expect prices to go higher.
Despite tighter supplies from the Middle East during the summer season, traders said the impact has been gradually discounted and saw small room for further price gains.
"The price is now at the high end," said one trader. "Demand is not significant except from the local buyer."
"And it seems he has no plans to bid up the market," the trader said.
The market was awaiting results of a Taiwan fuel oil export tender which closes on Monday, traders said.
Taiwan's state Chinese Petroleum Corp (CPC) seeks to sell a third 30,000-tonne cargo of 3.0-percent sulphur fuel oil for June lifting. The tender would be valid for two days.
The swaps market is also discounting the buying support from the cargo market due to bearish fundamentals with little incremental demand seen from the local bunker market and China.
June swaps were unchanged at $101.00/$101.50 and July swaps were little changed at $98.50/$99.00.
On SIMEX fuel oil futures contract, no transaction was
reported on late Friday. June contract was bid/offered at
(Prices in dollars per tonne, unless stated)
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
JUL FUEL OIL SWAPS 98.50/99.00 99.00/99.50
*Dollars per barrel
-- Singapore newsroom (+65-870 3571)
